text.p: Parametric Technology Corp chief financial officer Ed Gillis said the company is comfortable with fiscal 1998 earnings estimates in the range of $2.05 a share to $2.10 a share.

On a consensus basis, analysts expect Parametric to earn $2.10 a share in fiscal 1998, according to First Call. The range of estimates for the eight analysts surveyed by First Call was $2.05 to $2.17 a share.
Parametric's stock was halted on Nasdaq news pending. Before being halted, Parametric shed 3-3/8 to 44 and was among the most heavily-traded stocks.
Parametric also reiterated that it was comfortable with the consensus fiscal 1997 earnings estimate of $1.65 a share, Gillis said.
Parametric posted earnings from operations of $1.19 a share for the year ended September 30, 1996.
Parametric develops software products used for the mechanical computer-aided design, manufacturing and engineering industries.
Alex. Brown analyst Philip Rueppel said Parametric's guidance on fiscal 1998 earnings fell short of his expectations of $2.15 a share.
